name: Berlin
description: The capital of Germany, known for its cultural heritage and modern landmarks.

name: Munich
description: A city in Bavaria, famous for its annual Oktoberfest and beer halls.

name: Cologne
description: A 2,000-year-old city spanning the Rhine River in western Germany.

name: Hamburg
description: A major port city in northern Germany, connected to the North Sea by the Elbe River.

name: Frankfurt
description: A central German city on the river Main, a major financial hub.

name: Stuttgart
description: The capital of southwest Germany’s Baden-Württemberg state, known for its automotive industry.

name: Düsseldorf
description: The capital of North Rhine-Westphalia, known for its fashion industry and art scene.

name: Leipzig
description: A city in eastern Germany known for its vibrant cultural scene and historic significance.

name: Nuremberg
description: Famous for its medieval architecture and historical significance in World War II.

name: Bremen
description: Known for its role in the Hanseatic League and its UNESCO-listed town hall.

name: Dresden
description: Famous for its reconstructed historic center and art treasures.

name: Freiburg
description: A city in the Black Forest known for its medieval minster and eco-friendly policies.

name: Heidelberg
description: Home to Germany's oldest university and a picturesque old town.

name: Karlsruhe
description: Known for its grid-like city layout and as a major center of technology.

name: Augsburg
description: One of Germany's oldest cities, known for its Renaissance architecture.

name: Tübingen
description: Known for its medieval old town and as a hub for education and research.
